sentences.sentence: The Ants( 蚂蚁 ) and the Grasshopper( 蝗虫 )
It was a fine winter day, and the ants( 蚂蚁 ) were storing away( 贮存 ) all the food they had collected( 收集 ) in the summer.
A very hungry grasshopper( 蝗虫 ) passed by and asked them for something to eat.
The ants( 蚂蚁 ) asked him, “Why didn’t you collect( 收集 ) any food during the summer?”
He replied( 回复 ), “I didn’t have any spare( 空闲的 ) time—I spent the days singing.”
Then they said, “If you were foolish( 愚蠢的 ) enough to sing all summer, you must dance hungry to bed in the winter.”
MORAL: Prepare( 准备 ) today for the needs of tomorrow.
The Astronomer( 天文学家 )
An astronomer( 天文学家 ) used to go out every night to look at the stars.
One night, while looking up to the skies, he fell into a well.
Someone who heard his cries, ran up to him, and said,
“While you are trying to learn about the mysteries( 奥秘 ) of heaven( 天空 ), you miss( 错过 ) the common things under your feet.”
MORAL: We should never look so high that we miss( 错过 ) seeing the things around us.
The Bald( 秃头的 ) Man and the Fly
A fly bit( 叮 ) the head of a bald( 秃头的 ) man who, trying to kill it, only succeeded in hitting himself hard on the head.
Escaping( 逃脱 ), the fly made fun( 玩笑 ) of him, saying,
“You who have wished to revenge( 报复 ), even with death, the bite( 叮 ) of a tiny insect( 昆虫 ),
see what harm( 伤害 ) you have done to yourself in the process!”
The bald( 秃头的 ) man replied( 回答 ), “I hurt( 弄伤 ) myself by mistake( 无意中 ), but you hurt( 弄伤 ) me on purpose.
I wish that I could have killed you, even if by doing so I had hurt( 弄伤 ) myself even more!”
MORAL: Don’t hurt( 弄伤 ) yourself to get revenge( 报复 ) on another.
The Bee( 蜜蜂 ) and Zeus
A queen( 王后 ) bee( 蜜蜂 ) flew up to heaven( 天国 ) to give Zeus some fresh honey( 蜂蜜 ).
Zeus, happy with the gift( 对...感到满意 ), promised( 许诺 ) to give her whatever she should ask for.
She said, “Give me a sting( （昆虫的）刺 ), so if any man tries to take my honey( 蜂蜜 ), I can hurt( 伤害 ) him.”
Zeus was very unhappy, as he loved men, but could not refuse( 拒绝 ) because of his promise( 诺言 ).
He then answered the bee( 蜜蜂 ), “You shall have your sting( （昆虫的）刺 ), but it will cost you your own life.
If you use your sting( （昆虫的）刺 ), it will stay in their body, and you will die from the loss of it.”
MORAL: By hurting( 伤害 ) others, we often hurt( 伤害 ) ourselves.
The Bees( 蜜蜂 ) and the Beekeeper( 养蜂人 )
A thief( 小偷 ) got into a beekeeper( 养蜂人 )’s property when its owner was away and stole( 偷窃 ) all the honey( 蜂蜜 ).
When the owner came back and saw that the honey( 蜂蜜 ) was gone,
he stood there thinking about what had happened.
The bees( 蜜蜂 ) then came back to their home and when they found the beekeeper( 养蜂人 ) there,
they attacked him fiercely( 猛烈地 ) with their stings( （昆虫的）刺 ).
The beekeeper( 养蜂人 ) said to the bees( 蜜蜂 ), “You stupid( 愚蠢的 ) creatures( 生物 )!
You let the man who stole( 偷窃 ) your honey( 蜂蜜 ) get away unpunished( 未受惩罚的 ),
while you direct your anger at me, the person who takes care of you and tries to protect( 保护 ) you!”
MORAL: People often blame( 把...归咎于 ) their misfortunes( 不幸 ) on their friends, rather than their enemies( 敌人 ).
The Belly( 胃 ) and the Body Parts
One day, all the body parts realized( 意识到 ) that they were doing all the work,
and the belly( 胃 ) was getting all the food.
They held a meeting, and after a long discussion( 讨论 ), decided to stop work until the belly( 胃 ) agreed to help.
So for a day or two, the hands refused( 拒绝 ) to take food,
the mouth refused( 拒绝 ) to receive( 接受 ) it,
and the teeth( 牙齿 ) had no work to do.
But after a few days, the other body parts began to find that they were not in good condition.
The hands could hardly move, and the mouth was dry, while the legs were unable to support the body.
They found that even the belly( 胃 ), in its quiet way, was doing necessary work.
They all must work together or the body will go to pieces.
MORAL: It takes all kinds of people to make human society work.

article_info.previous: 在昨天的故事里，蚂蚁嘲笑正在蜕变的毛虫，毛虫最后化茧成蝶，变成了一只漂亮的蝴蝶，这个故事告诉我们不要以面貌来评价一个人。
article_info.share_words: Prepare today for the needs of tomorrow. We should never look so high that we miss seeing the things around us.

question.cn: 在故事The Ants and the Grasshopper中，蚂蚱为什么没有在夏天储存食物？
question.en: In the story the Ants and the Grasshopper, why didn't the grasshopper collect any food during summertime?

options.cn: 因为他整天整天的唱歌。
options.en: Because he spent his days singing.

options.cn: 因为他不能找到足够的食物。
options.en: Because he couldn't find enough food.
Because he was too lazy to store any food.

analysis: 文中提到：“I didn't have any spare time, I spent the days singing.”由此可知，蚂蚱在夏天的时候把时间用来唱歌，所以没有储存冬天的食物，因此选A。

question.cn: 在故事The Astronomer中，天文学家为什么会摔进井里？
question.en: In the story the Astronomer, why did the astronomer fall into a well?

options.cn: 因为他只关注天空而忽视了地面。
options.en: Because he focused too much on the sky and missed the things on the ground.

analysis: 文中提到天文家的邻居说：“while you are trying to learn about the mysteries of heaven, you miss the common things under your feet.”因此选B。

question.cn: 在故事The Bee and Zeus中，为什么蜜蜂想要一根刺？
question.en: In the story the Bee and Zeus, why did the bee ask to have a sting?

analysis: 文中提到 she said, “Give me a sting, so if any man tries to take my honey, I can hurt him.” 可知，蜜蜂想要一根刺的原因是要保护自己的蜂蜜，因此选A。

question.cn: 在故事The Bee and the Beekeepers中，谁偷了蜜蜂的蜂蜜？
question.en: In the story the Bees and the Beekeeper, who stole the honey?

analysis: 文中提到：“ a thief got into a beekeeper's property when its owner was away and stole all the honey...” 由此可知，小偷偷走了蜂蜜，因此选B。

question.cn: 在故事The Belly and the Body Parts中，为什么身体的其他器官拒绝工作？
question.en: In the story the Belly and the Body Parts, why did other body parts refuse to work?

options.cn: 他们认为胃得到所有食物很不公平。
options.en: They thought it was unfair that the belly got all the food.

options.cn: 他们没有得到足够的能量。
options.en: They didn't have enough energy to move.
They were not in good condition.

analysis: 文中身体其他器官认识到 ，“They thought it was unfair that they did all the work but the belly got all the food.”所以它们讨论决定抵制工作，直到胃同意帮助他们，因此选A。

share_title: 100天读完3本英文书，今天是第2天
